title: 110_hr5713
content: The "Splash and Dash Correction Act of 2008" clarifies eligibility for certain fuel credits for fuel with insufficient nexus to the United States, enacted under constitutional authority. The "Splash and Dash Correction Act of 2008" limits alcohol credits to alcohol produced in or entered into the United States for consumption within the country. The "Splash and Dash Correction Act of 2008" restricts alcohol credits to alcohol produced in or entered into the United States for consumption within the country. Additionally, the amendment limits the biodiesel credit to biodiesel connected to the United States. The biodiesel and biodiesel mixture credits are only applicable to products produced or entered into the United States for consumption within the country, with no credits available for products destined for export. The excise tax credits for biodiesel and biodiesel mixtures are limited to products produced or entered into the United States for domestic consumption, with no credits available for products destined for export. The excise tax credits for biodiesel and biodiesel mixtures are limited to products produced or entered into the United States for domestic consumption, with no credits available for products destined for export. No amount shall be payable under paragraph (1) or (2) with respect to any mixture or alternative fuel if credit is determined with connection to the United States. The amendments made by this section apply to fuel sold or used after the date of the enactment of this Act.
